arts.ttl: From bad to worse! Saints fans learn last train home is cancelled during loss!
arts.sum: Just as Southampton fans thought it couldn't get any worse after seeing their team fall to 3-1 defeat to Bournemouth, it was announced their last train home was cancelled!

arts.ttl: Angry Southampton boss accuses 'ridiculous' players after Premier League defeat
arts.sum: Southampton were beaten 3-1 at Bournemouth on Monday night, with their first-half display - during which they conceded three times - being lamented by under-fire boss Russell Martin

arts.ttl: Raging Russell Martin ‘really hurt’ by Southampton’s lack of fight
arts.sum: Saints went down 3-1 at south-coast rivals Bournemouth.

arts.ttl: Semenyo and Evanilson star as Bournemouth beat Southampton
arts.sum: Bournemouth's first home win of the season moves them 11th in the Premier League standings, while Southampton are 19th with just a solitary point from six matches. Taylor Harwood-Bellis reduced the areas early in a second half in which Southampton, to their credit, showed some fighting spirit, but it could not repair the damage of a disappointing opening 45 minutes.

arts.ttl: Martin 'hurt' by Saints performance | 'I didn't recognise my players'
arts.sum: Southampton manager Russell Martin slammed his side for their first-half performance in the 3-1 defeat at Bournemouth in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Martin 'hurt' by Saints performance | 'I didn't recognise my players'
arts.sum: Southampton manager Russell Martin slammed his side for their first-half performance in the 3-1 defeat at Bournemouth in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Southampton still winless after losing to south coast rival Bournemouth
arts.sum: Brazilian striker Evanilson got his first goal for the Cherries and Antoine Semenyo starred, scoring one and making another as Bournemouth plundered all three goals in a rampant first 45 minutes. Bournemouth beat Southampton 3-1 and prolonged the latter’s miserable start to the English Premier League on Monday.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth 3-1 Southampton: Highlights, man of the match, stats
arts.sum: Three first-half goals see Bournemouth record their first home victory of the season against a winless Southampton at the Vitality Stadium.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth blow away struggling Southampton as Russell Martin call backfires
arts.sum: BOURNEMOUTH 3-1 SOUTHAMPTON: First-half goals from Evanilson, Dango Ouattara and Antoine Semenyo laid the groundwork for a comfortable home victory for the Cherries

arts.ttl: Antoine Semenyo inspires Bournemouth to convincing win over sorry Southampton
arts.sum: Semenyo scored one and was involved in his side’s other two goals.
